moves.10. Na4 Nbd7: After Nxc5 Nxc5 the e4 pawn will be under attack.
moves.11. Nh4: Prepares Nf5, which is a big threat for black. The e4 pawn must fall immediately.
moves.11... Nxe4 12. Rxe4: The rook protects the knight, however, the f line is now open for the f7 pawn.
moves.13... Rxf5: The f2 pawn is under pressure from black, white decides to take the bishop.
moves.15... Qf6 16. b4: The knight is essential in the attack on f2 pawn. However, the e4 square is guarded by white's rook.
moves.19. Rxf5 Qxf5 20. f3: The only move to prevent capture. This leads, however, to great knight positioning.
moves.20... Ng3 21. Qxd6: Wins a pawn, looses a tempo.
moves.21... h4: Critical move. The pawn guards the knitght which threatens the black king.
moves.22. Be3 e4: Threatens to open the f line. White's rook cannot move to f1 because of the knight guard.
moves.23. f4 g5: Black's pieces are placed strategically. White cannot check black's king, and makes a pawn capture...
moves.24. fxg5 Qf1+: Qf1! The f line opened and a mate in 2 is unleashed.
moves.25. Rxf1 Rxf1+ 26. Kh2 Rh1#: The h pawn protector turned out to be crucial here. Many thanks to okat for the game!
